-4* Exhibit No0 10
8:30 PH
OUR CHANGING EARTH
A course concerned first, with the common minerals and
rocks comprising the earth's crust, and, secondly, with
the processes acting upon and within the earth. Natural
phenomena, such as gorges, waterfalls, deltas, caverns,
geysers and hot springs, sand dunes» lakes, shore features,
glaciation, and earthquakes will be discussed.
Professor C. Wroe Wolfe, Boston University, Commission on
Extension Courses»
Live presentation from the WGBH studios, utilizing films
and slides when appropriate*

7:30 PM
HOW TO - BUY
Instruction on buying food, clothing, household and other
family and personal items with emphasis on seasonal values,
quality standards and tests, fair pricing and other factors
important to the consumer.
Faculty specialists from Greater Boston colleges and univ¬
ersities and adult education centers and others.

7:45 PM
LET'S GET OUTDOORS
Talks on bird, insect9 tree and plant identification and
other nature studies with suggestions on routes, equipment,
etcfor field trips.
Specialists from Greater Boston colleges and universities
and community nature study groups, ecg., The Massachusetts
Audubon Society, the Museum of Science and Industry and
others.
Live presentation from the WGDII studios, utilizing films
slides and photographs when appropriate,,
